file_content.text: Got to keep the people on the Republic's side, see. Can't win the war without their support.
The shipment--did you get it? Tell me you got it.
I ordered the droid to destroy your spice.
It's been destroyed.
What were you doing buying spice?
Why spice?
What? How did you--? It was the droid that done it--told you it was spice. And you destroyed it, too. Dumb droid.
It's gone, you filthy liar.
You lied to me.
What? You didn't destroy it, did you? That droid told you it was spice, didn't he?
You shouldn't have destroyed it, though. You don't know what you did. I'm an honest man, see.
When I said the supplies were for the villagers--I meant it. See, spice is the only thing that makes them stupid enough to support the Republic.
Maybe you could actually give them food.
Try something else.
Food? These are hard times. Soldiers need the food. The people can eat grass.
Don't look at me.
Easy for you to say. But I've got to think about me and my family as well as the Republic.
Got to think of what happens if the separatists move in, see.
Seems like you're stupid enough without the stuff.
You're an idiot.
Take your insults elsewhere. Now I need a Plan B. Gotta think.
What are you still standing around here for? You've done your damage. Go on. Go on.
You're back. Great. And you got the shipment. Great. Fantastic. Give it to me.
Is it true that there's spice in this container?
So is this really spice?
Take your "supplies," Gizmel.
Supplies, huh?
Hey hey hey. It's not like it's for me. This is Ord Mantell, you know. Loyalty comes at a price.
This is wrong.
I won't be your spice dealer.
Leave me out of it.
You think. But I got bigger things to think about. Happy citizens are lawful citizens, see. People have wants, needs.
And the separatists will provide whatever I don't. And then where are we? Me, you, the Republic? Knee-deep in bantha poo. That's where.
I guess I understand.
That's the stuff. Can't let legalities interfere with the good of the people.
So why don't you just give me the shipment, eh? For the good of the Republic and the people of Ord Mantell.
Fine. Take the shipment.
Take it.
I knew you were the reliable type. You understand priorities, you do.
No. You're gonna watch while I destroy it.
No. [Destroy spice]
What did you do that for? That's not being a good sport at all now, is it? No, that's just plain stupid.
What am I supposed to pay the people off with now?
Your problem.
Eh, some help you turned out to be.
At least you won't be poisoning them.
Spice is bad.
Eh, haven't you done enough damage?
Try credits--or real supplies.
Use something else.
Nobody's got that much money--not on Ord Mantell.
Go on. Go. I've got to think, and fast.
Money. Now.
Absolutely. No question. Thanks for doing this for me.
The Republic owes you one. We'll win those villagers back in no time.
It was nothing.
Heh. Yes, you are. Good work.
Yeah yeah. I only did it for the credits.
Just pay me.
Don't care why you did it; it's done. Heh.
Anything to help the Republic cause.
I live to serve.
That's right. Heh. You said it.
I just hope I haven't made a big mistake.
I better not regret this.
I'm sure I don't know what you're talking about.
The shipment. You got it yet? No? Well, get it then.
Hey, uh, you there. You got a second? Talk politics? Talk shop? Talk business, maybe? I've got business to talk, if you're interested in talking.
Business?
Good business. Government business. Republic business. The kind that can make you some money and help the cause.
I'm not interested in buying anything today.
No thanks.
I'm not selling anything. I'm paying. For a job. For the Republic. For Ord Mantell. Need some good loyal workers.
Be quick.
Absolutely. Just listen to what I have to say, and if you don't like it, you walk, okay?
Name's Gizmel Gam. I'm with the government here. So what do you say? Interested in doing a little work? For me? For you? For the Republic?
I'll do what I can to help the Republic, but I'm going to need more information before I agree to anything.
It's my duty to serve.
That's the stuff I'm looking for. Good Republic brand loyalty. Follows orders, loves the Republic, would die for the cause. But won't rush in blind. Good stuff.
I don't work for free, you know.
Depends on the pay.
Go on.
Talk faster.
Hey there. That's a little rude, ain't it? Someone offers you work, and you snap at him.
I was trying to offer you a job, but now maybe I'll rescind my offer.
I was wrong.
Everyone makes mistakes, gets impatient. I won't hold it against you.
All right. But let's talk money, first.
What about pay?
There's a fair amount of pay involved--not a lot, mind you. These are tough times, you know. But this is important and well worth a reward.
If you would get to the point, I wouldn't snap at you.
You deserved it.
I'm getting to the point. In fact, I'm nearly there.
Here's the situation: I look after one of the outlying villages, and this village is, well, faltering in its love of the Republic. People are restless, see.
The separatists bring 'em stuff, and they start thinking the separatists are right. Then they get uppity, start talking about revolt, start getting violent. It's chaos everywhere.
What do you need?
You need me to shoot some villagers?
So shoot them.
Shooting villagers is no way to win their hearts.
The separatists have gone too far. They must be stopped.
I hate those separatists.
Absolutely. And I have a plan.
I figure the best way to win the village over is to beat the separatists at their own game. Lavish the villagers with gifts. Show 'em we care, too.
So I ordered a shipment of supplies. But now I get word the shipment's lost out in savrip territory. I need someone to go get it.
I'll do whatever it takes to return your shipment.
You can count on me.
No problem.
I guess I could have a look.
I might be able to.
Fine. Good. That's all I ask. Have a look. The shipment had a droid escort I believe, so I'd look for that if I were you.
It was last seen on savrip island. Savrips--you know, massive, vicious beasts, eat you for dinner soon as look at you.
Savrip island. Got it.
Understood.
Got to rush.
Good. I like to hear that. Good luck.
We'll see if I get to it.
Sounds like a waste.
Keep in mind--Republican loyalty is at stake!
Keep fighting the good fight, trooper.
Stay out of trouble in town, stranger. I've got enough on my hands as it is.
Welcome to Oradam village!
